subject: Personal Finance
title: Why a Coffee Costs $6
description: A quick win: understand Why a Coffee Costs $6.

hook.text: The beans in your $6 latte cost about 30 cents. So where does the other $5.70 go?

buildup.text: Rent, labor, equipment, branding, and convenience make up most of the cost of finished goods.

discovery.text: You're not paying for coffee. You're paying for a warm seat, WiFi, and a drink made for you.

twist.text: Starbucks earns more from real estate strategy than from coffee margins. Location is the real product.

climax.text: Every product's price tells a story about supply chains, labor, rent, and the value customers perceive.

punchline.text: You're buying the experience, not the beans.
